__e: Sir, we are here to find out the truth, and I'm not going to ignore what I know.
Why is it that I have to do everything that you tell me to, but you can ignore whatever Jessica tells you to do?
Look, I'm sorry, but I can't ignore what's right in front of me.
But you're my boss, too, and that's hard to ignore, I know.
Why is it that I have to do everything that you tell me to, but you can ignore whatever Jessica tells you to do?
I just want to say that if we're gonna continue working together, then we really should not ignore the other night.
I just can't get over the fact that you put our kids in harm's way like that.
But you can't ignore the fact that... some of us aren't making out on this deal very well.
So, I'll sleep in the dead girl's room and do my best to not dwell on the fact that there's a big old bloodstain on the floor.
He can't just ignore his daughter on the biggest day of her life.
Yeah well, you know, ignoring the person you're married to is a big part of making it work, right?
Hurry home tonight so you can ignore your son and not do your share.
Your apology is not working out very well, so I'm going to choose to ignore most of it, and,um,I will see you... Tomorrow.
I thought maybe even we... Look, I know you want her not to have done this, but as her friend, as her lawyer, you--you can't ignore the truth just because you wish it wasn't so.
In fact, to do either of them very well, you have to pretty much ignore one of them altogether, which is what i've done.
I'm going to ignore that, because if I don't, I will weep.
What, are you just going to ignore that, when you could do something about it?
And if people need me, I can't exactly ignore that.
You were able to look past the things that I had done before I came to the FBI.
No, it's never better staying ignorant.
It makes it easier for you to compromise the next time and soon that's all you're doing is compromising because that's how you think things are done.
